channel.title: [RS2++] New server base (In Development)
channel.description:
Currently I'm developing a new server base in response to Mopars [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,345848.0.html]Paying for private servers and more[/url] thread.
Server core is coded in C++. Supports scripting in LUA. All packet's and a few other things will be handled strictly through scripting.
The server is currently being developed to support 317 but is being developed in such a way that it will be able to switch which client protocol is handled without causing any big problems.
Current Progress: Handles Login. (So impressive right?!)
More complete information and pictures will come soon.
SVN: https://rs2plusplus.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/rs2plusplus All code on the SVN is subject to change. Alot of it is placeholder until the scripting engine is 100% integrated. It by no means reflects the final product as this is early development code.
Removed embedded image, far too big. Follow the link to see. http://i260.photobucket.com/albums/ii7/AridTag/RS2PP/Screenshot.png

item.title: [RS2++] New server base (In Development)
item.dc:creator: @AridTag AridTag
item.description:
@AridTag wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:56, topic:341634”]my suspicions were correct, heres the breakdown:

-you’re using select completely wrong. you are supposed to fill the fdset with all the FD’s then call select, not one at a time.
-you’re using c++, but the c lua api. luabind is all-around better
-having packets scripted at all is a bad idea, as its going to be slow. higher level scripting is the way to go
-the encoder abstraction is very poor. in my server, for example, the encoder is loaded from a dll at runtime
-ripped isaac from common rsps. should have used a c implementation, for the one you used is inefficient

overall it is lacking extremely in abstraction

@ not wanting to post unfinished code, why even post the thread if you dont have anything decent to show for it?[/quote]

I know select is being used incorrectly. Already stated that.
And what do you think luabind uses some magical C++ lua api? no it uses the lua c api.
The speed of the scripting is debatable and if I find that it is slow under load then obviously it would be changed.
I agree the encoder abstraction is poor its temporary.
Sure did isaac isn’t even being used anyway.

This code is extremely young more of a poc for myself than anything. Your arguments are fairly invalid. As I have said it is by no means final code.

Read full topic

Another point, everyone of lawl’s points that he made is 100% accurate.

item.title: [RS2++] New server base (In Development)
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“PeeHPee, post:51, topic:341634”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=438035.msg3221380#msg3221380 date=1275195007]
Your poor attempt at portability is actually quite funny. Preprocessor conditional definitions are better than preprocessor conditional invocations all around your application; also, please refrain from using the preprocessor anywhere other than in header files - it’s quite repugnant.

Theres a few things that need to change and I know that. As stated its early development code. Some of it is quickly thrown together.

edit: and yes kudos for using select

edit2: it’s poor threading code though. It is being changed for a set number of threads and each thread will handle a set amount of players. We don’t need nor do we want 3,000 threads running.

select sucks dick on windows and is obsolete on linux btw.

if you’re going for a certain platform i’d use io completion ports on windows or epoll on linux for networking.
[/quote]What the hell are you on about, select is great on either platform if used properly.

uhh what the hell are YOU on about? looping through every file descriptor on every call to select is hardly great.[/quote]Considering the fd_set only contains socket descriptors who’re ready to receive/send a packet, it’s no different than the synchronized queuing mechanism used with completion ports, which are to be iterated through, as well.

Read full topic

item.title: [RS2++] New server base (In Development)
item.dc:creator: @PeeHPee PeeHPee
item.description:
@PeeHPee wrote:

[quote=“AridTag, post:43, topic:341634”][quote author=PeeHPee link=topic=438035.msg3221334#msg3221334 date=1275190986]
looking at the class naming i can see (ClientSocket, PlayerHandler, etc) this is just another gay winterLove clone written in C++.
[/quote]

FYI PlayerHandler does not exist. It is PlayerManager which isn’t being used. Dead class I hadn’t removed. ClientSocket is nothing more than a nice wrapper around a socket to make life easy (ok well it may be a little more than a nice wrapper but nothing like the ridiculous client.java). Your ignorance on what I am doing means you should keep your ridiculous claims to yourself.

Beginning to regret I ever started a topic here.[/quote]

Post code then you fucking idiot.

edit: or at least more information, how the fuck are we supposed to get an idea of what you are doing with an image?

Read full topic
